summary.para: Implements a that reads characters from a byte stream in a particular encoding.

remarks.para: The class is designed for character input in a particular , whereas subclasses of are designed for byte input and output.

block.para: defaults to UTF-8 encoding unless specified otherwise, instead of defaulting to the ANSI code page for the current system. UTF-8 handles Unicode characters correctly and provides consistent results on localized versions of the operating system.
When reading from a , it is more efficient to use a buffer that is the same size as the internal buffer of the stream.

summary.para: Allows a to discard its buffered data.
